reviews.text:
Always an enjoyable experience attending a show here. I have been to Gamut MULTIPLE times and I have always felt like I was sitting beside friends though they were strangers. 
Not only is this place worth a visit, it is super affordable!!!!
Saw the Murderess show on their Second Stage, it was a beautiful space. Everyone was so friendly and welcoming, they put on an amazing show and I will definitely be back in the future!

Beautiful space! Looks like it used to be a church or cathedral of some sort. Seating is limited... maybe 50 or 60 seats. And it's all floor level. Still, fantastic setup. Drinks weren't too over priced either.
Amazing performance. Great venue

A true gem in very cool renovated church.  Popcorn Hat Players produce shows for the younger set while adding lines to appeal to adults; I have never left a show without laughing.  The actors meet the audience afterward so the youngsters can ask question.  Free Shakespeare in the Park is not to be missed!  The productions are top quality and the venue allows BYOB and picnic-style dinners, if you choose.  The "regular" productions are well done.  The caliber of the acting and producing are  amazing.
A lovely small theatre with the greatest live entertainment in Central Pennsylvania. My wife and I will surely be return visitors.🇺🇸🤗🇺🇸

This place offers really good live performances that you would not expect to find in a town this size. I've seen a few shoes here and all were fantastic. It's a level above community theatre for sure.
An intimate venue. Talented, enthusiastic singers.
Wonderful professional quality shows at one of the oldest community theaters in the country.

Theater Harrisburg is probably the best place to go for a live theater in the Harrisburg Area ever. If you do not go to this place you are missing a great opportunity for a cultural experience that you'll never forget. The next time I go I hope i have a cute date that goes with me.
This place in a nice little art museum to go to on short notice or stop in if your in town.

What a lovely treasure. Through work I went to a small wine and art night the gallery was hosting. The curator was very knowledgeable and did a good job of coaching us through our opinions of the artwork. The work they do with local youth is encouraging as well. Can't wait to go back for another exhibit.

We were there for 3rd in the burg,  loved the wine and the snacks, and the art was pretty cool too! Everyone was very friendly.  It's great that they change the exhibits every few months.  I have seen such a big variety of artworks thanks to this museum.

I volunteer here and I find this place to be fantastic. I love the installations and the people at the museum. It seems to be in an odd spot but I'm not 100% familiar with Harrisburg. It is in an old bank which is super cool. My only complaint is the parking lot is a bit rough, but there is on street parking! I highly recommend this place, it has wonderful artwork and is so cheap.
The staff was friendly.  I enjoyed the paintings by Danielle Klebes, and the dazzling display of light art by Luke Murphy.  They also had displays of the mural art from around the city.
Chris was a phenomenal server and made sure I was taken care of. I had the fig and pig pizza. It was savory and full of flavor. First time here and I plan to come back to explore the menu further!

*Harrisburg location* 
If you eat food here I think you will probably have a good time. 

That being said — for having a hundred beers on tap and a giant bar, this place is a flop. This place has the potential to be the go to place in Harrisburg but has very poor service. I’m sorry to say this isn’t a one time thing. We have been several times and consistently had bartenders that seem to be annoyed by our existence, even though the bar is almost empty. I feel bad that they are so unhappy to work there!

I promise I’m not just writing this to be rude. I urge the management to teach their bartenders about how much building relationships with customers can matter — especially in a small town like Harrisburg. 
Good luck!
The short rib grilled cheese sandwich was slammin. I wish I had taken a picture. Really good fries and an awesome beer selection. Good place for a quiet solo lunch at the bar too.
great place to meet and catch up with friends. looking forward to coming back with my friends. prices were reasonable. they have a lot of positive reviews for a reason.

The food and service was great. The floor plan is very open with great style. When we were there ,there was a family of atleast 20 and the way it's set up, you could barely tell they were there. The selection of beer was fantastic, there's something for everyone. We will be back again.
Family ritual. Great tasting food. Fast service.  Caters to Celiac family member. Many Gluten-free menu options and friendly personnel are knowledgeable about not cross-contaminating food items.
Great Scott!  That’s a huge amount of food!  The portions you get here are huge!  The quality is great!  And the staff is always friendly.  Vegetarian options as well.  Great atmosphere as well.
Great!  Its a little hidden so make sure you're closely looking when trying to get there.  Awesome people,  awesome food!  (Guy with glasses and and hair in a ponytail was cute tbh)
Best burritos ever.  These burritos are crazy big and tasty....dare I say it?  Better than Robs! There. I said it.

Can't go wrong with a bean football. That's what this place has - footballs, stuffed with beans. And rice. And meat. And anything you might want in a burrito. It's fantastic, and that's pretty much all that needs said. I've been going to Neato Burrito for years, and never been disappointed. For those unfamiliar with it, you could say it's similar to Chipotle, but so much better...

After a 10 day road trip around Egypt we spent our last day in Cairo at this hotel. It was bliss. They upgraded us to a suite, which was large, with two bathrooms and a great view. The room service breakfast was delicious and plentiful, and the bed was a pleasure to sleep in. The best part was the spa on the rooftop, with fresh scented aromatic candles burning along the entrance hallway; comfy plush bathrobes and slippers and a hot tub (one for men and one for women). Definitely have a hot drink and sweet at the lobby café. They make amazing chocolate creations, both to eat and to drink.

Staff is unbelievably kind, helpful and devoted. 

I visited most of the 5* hotels in this area (after 2 weeks of being in Cairo) and experienced their lobby, restaurants, pool etc and I can say without a doubt that the Kempinski is the one that gets a 10 on all checkmarks. 

Definitely is my go to hotel in Cairo for my next trips..thank you to the management for doing such a great job with the staff!

Its less than the average 5 Stars regarding the entrance, design and breakfast buffet. The team starting from the security reaching to the rooftop is very kind, helpful and welcoming. Regarding the prices i found it a little bit cheaper comparing to neighbour 5 stars hotels

Rooms are ok although sometimes they smell (smoke) breakfast is good! I originally gave three stars to the hotel but I just upgraded it to 4. Why? Because the staff answered to my comment and very politely promised that they will take better care of the rooms to avoid smoke smell. This is fantastic, well done!

Very enjoyable stay at this hotel, my wife and I booked four nights there and we were pleased with the service and the staff from the reception to the house keeping. 
The buffet is excellent and great variety of food, the service in the breakfast restaurant was excellent, and it is worth mentioning that we have not noticed any of the waiters pushing for tipping.

We come across minor problems with the shower,  one of the managers, a lady by the name of Aya, arranged a quick fix.

In general we were very pleased with the hotel and staff. 

Highly recommended.
the service was very helpful and observant. bring your appetite because portions are generous. my apartment is far from here, so i can't visit often.

They have a shot with bacon. If you go there and dont get it, you've failed.  Definitely a good little secret in the heart of Harrisburgs downtown area.  The bar also sports a golden tee and darts which are crowd favorites
Great prices &good size drinks. Staff is so friendly &will remember a face (&regular drink) no matter what. That's what really makes a place good downtown Harrisburg.
Great bar, extremely courteous staff. Not too crowded with plenty of seating. Casual environment. Definitely worth stopping in.

I love the Brick Haus. As a local,  it's always one of my go-to spots. If you can't stand smoking, it's not going to be the place for you since people are able to smoke inside,  however if that doesn't bother you, it's great!  The owner is a truly fantastic person and the two story watering hole reminds me of an old college bar from my early 20s. There's a Touch Tunes jukebox on each floor and a dartboard on the second floor. Bartender Mike is always super attentive and though I can't remember her name,  the girl that always bartends on the 1st floor on weekends is also fantastic. 
If you go,  remember to try their famous Lumberjack shot.  It's seriously like breakfast in a shot glass,  complete with a full strip of bacon. Chomp a bite of bacon,  cheers your friends and say "Timber!" and then bottoms up.   
Prost!

We went here on the recommendation of a business acquaintance and were very happy we did. Service was excellent and they actually remember how timing is supposed to be between appetizer and entree. We had the firecracker shrimp for an appetizer, really tasty and a good size portion. My wife had the bacon wrapped scallops and I had the fish and chips. Very, very good and the fish portion was huge. Loved the heavy lacquer paint scheme and the overall layout, as well as all the fire engine memorabilia and models. Really can't recommend this place enough. Great job Firehouse.

We went here on the recommendation of a business acquaintance and were very happy we did. Service was excellent and they actually remember how timing is supposed to be between appetizer and entree. We had the firecracker shrimp for an appetizer, really tasty and a good size portion. My wife had the bacon wrapped scallops and I had the fish and chips. Very, very good and the fish portion was huge. Loved the heavy lacquer paint scheme and the overall layout, as well as all the fire engine memorabilia and models. Really can't recommend this place enough. Great job Firehouse.

While everything we ordered was very good, we all thought the gumbo was delicious - even the bread was mentioned as excellent. We also had the duck cake app - unusual and good as well. My ribs and shrimp were nicely done, the stone chicken well above the usual chicken dish. Scallops, salmon salad - all very good. There was a small service mistake, which they apologized for several times - and comp'ed a drink -indicating that they have high standards. Recommended for sure.

Found this restaurant by accident and I'm really glad I did. The food was excellent. The soup of the day was chorizo orzo which was incredible. Duck cake appetizer was mind blowing. The steaks, which we had the tenderloin and smoked rib eye, were some of the best steaks we've had anywhere. The only negative was that none of the desserts sounded good but maybe that was because the rest of the meal was unbelievable. Firehouse don't you dare change those steaks. I'm a 100 miles away, but I'll be back definitely!
Great place to hang out with friends! Wonderful ambience. They specialize in bar food. Their servers are warm, friendly and welcoming, bringing out the best in their guests!

This place is a little hard to find but GPS will get you there.   This place is beautiful,  it shows management that cares.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the food was amazing.   The prices are comparable to other local Indian restaurants, but I would consider this upscale dining.   New favorite place!

Ever been to an Indian restaurant and think, "I'm not sure how much of this I'll like.". This is NOT that kind of place.
  The interior design is amazing.
   The food is amazing.
    The price is amazing.
 This place will certainly be in business for a LONG time, but do yourself a favor and stop here ASAP!

I used to enjoy this restaurant but I had not been there for years. We went back yesterday afternoon for lunch and unfortunately it was disappointing. We opted not to have the buffet, rather we ordered from the menu, and maybe that was the issue? It seems we were ignored. It took a long time to get our drinks. When our food arrived, it was cold. I had asked for a spice level of spicy, and there was no spice whatsoever.  After our meal we sat for about 20 minutes and no one acknowledged us. My fiance had to walk up to the register, which was also empty, and wait for someone to return so we could ask for boxes. After we were given boxes we sat for yet another 10 minutes and did not receive our check so eventually we had to go back to the register and wait AGAIN. I understand that they have to keep up with the buffet since it's a large draw, but if tending to the buffet causes them to ignore other paying customers and offer cold food then perhaps they should not even have the option to order off of the menu and do a buffet only. I will stick with the other Indian restaurant that I frequent that has hot food and more prompt service.
We have had Indian Food all over America and this was definitely one of the best Indian Restaurants we’ve been too. The food was delicious and so fresh.
One of my favorite Indian places to eat at for lunch with some coworkers. They changed the layout recently and seems like the food is being cooked by a different chef but overall still good.

I'm staying at the hotel this restaurant is in so I went here for a late dinner on Monday food came out cold the staff on that night was flirting with a couple women at the bar so I think they were more concerned with buying these women drinks obviously .I went back on Wednesday (as i said I'm staying at the hotel.)the food came out cold again but this time the manager(arron)was working he had them make me a fresh plate instead of just reheating it,he and the server apologized the food was great and I will be back. I recommend this restaurant if you appreciate great customer service and great food.

Amazing food and amazing service. Everyone was super nice, and gave us recommendations. The pizzas were some of the best we had. Lots of flavor, especially on the chorizo one. For the amount of the food, the price is really fair honestly. We're a bunch or college students so price was a concern, but we ended up spending around $10 each so it wasn't bad at all. Would definitely recommend checking out Bricco if you're in town, I know I'll be back.

I enjoy this place pretty often. Danm good gourmet food and stiff drinks. Whether you are feeling fancy or feeling causal this bar/restaurant is a great choice. I recommend the duck entree, med well to well done.
First time to the restaurant.  Went early. Jerrod was very good server. Food was good. I know it's not there fault, but be prepared for the street construction outside the restaurant.

If you want more for less! This is your spot 

The food wasn’t the best and it is more expensive than the portion they provide. The water comes without a straw you have to ask for it, and the food didn’t even have flavor. Waste of my money and time I paid $45 and I’m not even full. The hummus taste sweet? Huh???

Go somewhere else.

Excellent spot for lunch. They only do supper by reservation but I've heard it's fantastic and the price is decent. The pizza is one of the best priced lunches in the area. All of the food I've tried has been great. Always fast and friendly service. The pastries they sell are phenomenal. Will continue to stop by for lunch regularly.

A true hidden gem in Harrisburg!!! The atmosphere, staff, and food are all out of this world. Everything is homemade and made daily and you can truly taste how much passion is put into the food. The staff is super freindly and makes you feel like you are apart of their family. It is popular, you are going to want to call in advance for reservations.

The place to go if you want awesome Italian food and gelato. They are a bakery during the day, awesome pastries and gelato! During the weekend nights they make traditional Italian meals and they are delicious! The service is awesome, our waitress is the daughter of the owner and she is also a cook so she will give you a spot on description of the menu items!

This is my favorite hidden gem in Harrisburg. A real family affair with great breads, pizza, pastries, gelato, etc. I crave their sesame bread. 5 stars. The people behind the counter have a real passion. Their pizza is on huge delicious chunks of bread. Their sandwiches are killer. Don’t drive or walk by.
Most amazing food as usual. Love it, looking forward to going back soon.
Great little place with wonderful service. The Indian Monsoon is exceptional.

I've learned so much from Ambreen. Whether it's about the coffee farmers or bean flavors and preparations or the nutritional properties of her ingredients, she is very informed about her craft and I've become a more knowledgeable consumer by coming to Cafe Di Luna. As for taste: she has flavors from around the world. Every drink I've tried was DELICIOUS. Favorites include Malaysian Ipo, Cashmere tea, Turkish latte, Indian Buzz, and Spiced Captain. Most of her drinks are made from scratch and natural ingredients so if you have any dietary restrictions or preferences she can adjust the drinks to suit you. The cafe itself is cozy and intimate... like a  livingroom- feels like home! 

Also, if you have a chance, ask her about the 'soul of the bean' project where she is working to get all of her coffee direct trade from the farms to her shop.

Used to be ok, now it's way overpriced and they charge for refills on the fountain soda, and the man tried to overcharge me by $5 extra for my meal, the pizza slice was big but not as good as before.. I would never go there again.

Not terrible food but definitely subpar. Salads are horrible. Pizzas are good, subs are weak on meat and have a odd taste, but are edible. Employees are respectful but always seem extremely slow on serving you.
Worse food ever. Drivers have no clue where they are going . Waited one hour and a half for food. Hoagie was so wet. Chicken wings was so dry and flavorless. Never will go again.
Were good in the beginning, but now they are starting to get cheap with the amount of meat on their subs.
The best place to go and get good food

ABSOULTELY LOVED THIS PLACE! originally from the pittsburgh area, was recommended to try this place from a friend and I can tell you that we will DEFINITELY will be back! The staff was great, food was AWESOME,price was very reasonable and atmosphere was very welcoming. It's also a BYOB restaurant which is such a BONUS.
Soooo good! Best ribs I've had in a long time. Also the Chicago Benedict is my favorite breakfast item
The food was so delicious, the food was super quick, and the service was excellent! I recommend the Pulled Pork!
